dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 4, 2023
titles: Compact Design Meets Improved Audio: The All-New Echo Dot with Clock Shines
reviews: \nI recently upgraded to the All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release) with clock and have been thoroughly impressed with the enhancements over the previous generation. This smart speaker not only maintains the convenience and features I've come to expect from the Echo Dot series but also introduces welcome improvements to its design and audio performance.The new spherical design is aesthetically pleasing and fits seamlessly into any room. The addition of the LED clock display is a practical and stylish touch, making it easy to glance at the time without relying on voice commands. The display also shows the temperature and timers, which I've found particularly useful in the kitchen.When it comes to audio performance, the All-New Echo Dot has significantly improved. The 5th Gen speaker boasts richer sound and deeper bass, making music, podcasts, and even Alexa's responses much more enjoyable to listen to. The device easily fills a room with clear, high-quality audio.Setup and integration with the Alexa app are as simple as ever, and the Echo Dot continues to support an extensive range of smart home devices, making it a versatile hub for home automation. Voice recognition is accurate and responsive, even in noisy environments.The only minor downside I've noticed is that the LED clock display could be brighter, making it easier to see during the day. However, this is a minor issue that doesn't detract from the overall performance and appeal of the device.In summary, the All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release) with clock is a fantastic addition to the Echo family, offering improved audio quality and a stylish design while maintaining the versatility and convenience that users have come to expect. I highly recommend this smart speaker for anyone looking to enhance their smart home setup or simply enjoy a compact and powerful speaker.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 5, 2023
titles: Alexa with Light Sensing LED Clock!
reviews: \nI've used Echo's for years. This is a nice update, with very good (not quite great) sound, small footprint, and nice appearance. I love the smart clock feature that will also "echo" other information such as the temperature when you ask for the weather, and the artist and track when you're listening to music.  It has a built-in motion sensor that you can use for programming events (using the Alexa App on your phone) such as turning on smart lights when you come into a room.  It also has a touch sensor so that when you tap the top, it will pause music or restart it.  It comes with a built-in thermometer that you can also use to program events such as turning on smart devices at certain temps.  the LED's will sense room light and  dim automatically in the dark, so you don't blind yourself at night, and you can set the base levels in the Alexa App.I bought two of these for our bathroom to listen to music and news while getting ready in the morning. You can pair them so they act as left and right speakers.  This works VERY well, they sound really good in paired stereo.  They will also share volume control, so changing the volume on one changes the volume on the other also.  When two Echos are in the same room, they will both activate with "Alexa" but only the closest one will respond to the command.By comparison, this Echo Dot sounds comparable to an Apple Home Pod mini (which I also use), but is far more functional, but less expensive, and it will still play the Apple Music service.  Recommended.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 26, 2023
reviews: \nI bought this as I have an old clock radio alarm (almost as old as me) as I like to wake up to music. My old alarm had a terrible radio receiver and could barely get any stations. Plus, it only had two alarm settings, so I was changing it every weekend. With the Echo dot, I can have a different alarm time and sound for each day of the week. You can also set the alarms by voice or though the app - super easy. Plus I have the alarm connected to different stations. On weekdays I wake up to a Pandora station and on weekends it is tied to my XMSirius account. I love seeing the clock at night and the light adjusts automatically to the brightness of the room. I've changed the voice to a man's voice as my wife says she is the only woman who can give me directions - I'm old enough to go with the flow! I also like to ask for the day's weather before I get up and going, so just a handy device. I recommend!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 27, 2023
reviews: \nI have an older model of the Echo Dot, and between the two of the I have surround sound for my laptop, which is much better than the my laptop speaker for watching TV. I love being able to play music in the shower, and I can have surround sound on that as well. For such a small piece of equipment, the sound quality is incredible.I originally purchased my first Echo because I was sleeping through my alarms, but no more of that! Not only can I set the alarms to be loud, but I got two Alexa-compatible light bulbs that turn on when my first alarm is dismissed.Alexa recorded that the smoke alarms were going off when no one was home, and since there was confirmed no fire once my grandma arrived home, I was able to get new smoke alarms quickly from Amazon.I\u2019m sure they\u2019re reading deeply into my recorded voice of me snoring and singing in the shower, but somehow, I ain\u2019t too worried.I regularly forget to turn my wax melt off until I am out running errands, so an Alexa-compatible plug helps me with that.My fan is a table fan, as there is no ceiling fan in my bedroom, and Alexa even turns it on for me, turns out the compatible light bulbs, adjusts the speaker volume to 5, and then plays half an hour of the best sleep music I\u2019ve ever had to help lull me to sleep from Apple Music.Originally I had difficulty connecting Apple Music to Alexa, but once I disconnected everything and tried again it has worked perfectly since.Alexa even reminds me to take my nightly medicine, of which is much less effective when you regularly forget to take it (lol), and I am much more consistent and feeling better overall as a result of these medication reminders. When I go to visit my parents, they have to remind me to take them otherwise I still forget sometimes.I\u2019ve even used Alexa to help me get out of the shower in a timely fashion, as sometimes the hot water is extremely inviting and I lose track of time, so I\u2019ll just set a music timer and be on my way to an appointment on time.I am a caregiver for my 82-year-old grandma, and so Alexa has notified me on my phone while I was away that there was a loud crash in the house, and I was able to check on her and make sure she was okay.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 28, 2023
reviews: \nLove it, I don\u2019t really have any issues with it. The only issue is very rare she want listen to you. Not so often, not so little. But it\u2019s very rare when it happens. Everything is awesome, love how it actually does what I ask. I have her connected to my led light from daybetter. At first I didn\u2019t know why Alexa wouldn\u2019t connect to my led lights or why my led lights won\u2019t match my music. You learn so much and how to use it lol. Figure everything out on my own it was a struggle but worth it!If you are using led lights from daybetter and can\u2019t connect your led light to match with the music, you need to open the app of music so your led light music turns its mic on and once placed near Alexa so it can listen to the music it starts changing colors matching the beat. It\u2019s pretty awesome!! \U0001f496\U0001f496\U0001f496\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 15, 2023
titles: Awesome features , long review but worth the read
reviews: \nThis 5th generation is amazing,  Not only does it do everything you have come to enjoy out of even the basic,  earliest,echo dots. I just get amazed that it is such a security device,  1) it can sense when someone is in the room and alert your phone. 2) it can be set to guard when you're away,  will alert your phone no matter where your at,  to smoke detection sounds,  carbon monoxide warning alarms,  again alert you if it detects motion. 3) it can even tell you the temperature of the room you have placed it,  besides of course tell you the outside temperature 4) this is a bit techie and some might not find useful,  but if and only if is the "but" to this,  but if you have an eero router,  this is more than capable of extending your wifi range,  I have used it and it absolutely extended my signal , super speeds,  no but enough for everyday use,  YouTube,  email Netflix,  yes it produces strong enough for that,  large files,  gaming,  wouldn't do, Bottom line for the extra security and piece of mind it provides it's cost is a drop in the bucket,  and I would like to add before ending the review  a thought on the  Amazon and Alexa are spying on us,  Well yes I suppose they could if they opted to,  However,  anything you use,  your cell phone,  your tablet,  your laptop,  by any maker,  Google,  Apple,  Samsung and yes Amazon,  if any of the above chose to break the strict laws,  yes,  it is a fact they could listen to you,  any product with a microphone and wifi or cellular connection,  the makers of that device could remotely listen,  I gotta believe everyone knows this,  So I often wonder why Alexa and Amazon take so much heat for this when as stated , "any" of the modern devices we use Could notice could do this,  I just don't think these billion dollar companies want to take the risk of being destroyed by listening in on what we might be having for dinner or if we broke wind,  lol I could see where if you were some major felon where you might be concerned,  lol, but us everyday people,  not so much,  and remember the mafia rule,  someone is always listening,  so pass notes and burn the notes instantly after being read,  sorry could not resist,  lol, again bottom line is we live in a world of technology,  and while it brings great features and skills,  it all comes with a risk\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 25, 2023
titles: I love the new look and functionality
reviews: \nI love this Alexa. She looks very elegant in shape and size. Also there are many questions she can respond on them better than older Alexa for example her ability to find arabic contents its so amazing! dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 13, 2023
titles: Has connection issues and no temperature on-display
reviews: \nI expected this newer version of Echo dot to automatically be compatible with 5 ghz internet speed and display the temperature of my room(I have a device that displays indoor temperature, but that device is small and lacks brightness and I thought the Echo Dot 5 will display indoor temperature at every moment just like how the Echo displays the time) but that was a disappointment. Echo dot 5 does not measure your indoor temperature nor displays the temperature of your city/location as it does with the time. It only temporarily displays the temperature for a couple of seconds when you use a vocal command to ask the temperature out there.It also does not find your wifi during setup if your cellphone is connected to a 5 ghz only router. I spent 30 minutes and couldn't setup my 5ghz wifi. I was able to setup a temporary wifi by connecting to a "5ghz to 2.4 ghz wifi converter" (this converter saved me so many times because many smart devices don't connect to 5ghz wifi and my internet provider got rid of 2.4 ghz band on the router that they offer and people don't know that their router has no 2.4 ghz until they try to connect a smart device to wifi). After connecting to the 2.4 ghz, I was able to switch the internet connection back to 5 ghz. Some people in the past used a computer connection to bypass the wifi setup issue but I tried it and it doesn't work anymore.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 25, 2023
reviews: \nI think this was the best speaker to add in my spa! i love that i can connect to my apple music and podcast and can easily change between them all along with prime music with just my voice while in the middle of pampering my clients! i also love that it shows the time so i can easily keep track of time while doing a facial!  I would recommended to all!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 13, 2023
titles: This device runs circles around GOOGLE NEST/HUB. Also, the PRIVACY has vastly improved from 2018...
reviews: \nMahalo for making this truly an awesome experience.Ordered a complete whole home replacement 5th Gen DOTS/Clocks to replace our existing/outdated Google Smart Home MINI/Hub devices on 08JAN23 and arrived on 11JAN23 spent the next 30 minutes to 2.5 hours getting all devices placed into their respective places.  This is the total time it took as I do have ROUTINES that are CUSTOM as I'll explain below:-SET UP CUSTOM AMBIENT LIGHTING-SET UP CUSTOM MUSIC FROM SPOTIFY PLAYLIST + PAIRING WITH BLUETOOTH SPEAKERS-SET UP CUSTOM GROUPS FOR DEVICES-SET UP CUSTOM NAMES FOR DEVICES EVEN THOUGH THEY ARE ASSIGNED TO A GROUP (e.g.: LIVING ROOM TV, LANAI FAN, KITCHEN FAN, MASTER BEDROOM FAN as you want to be able to just say ALEXA turn off the Lanai Fan and she does it versus ALEXA turning off the lamps on the LANAI as well)-SETUP SKILLS FOR OUR SECURITY SYSTEM WERE SEAMLESS AND FASTSet up all the ROUTINES from my cell phone using the ALEXA APP and I love that you can COPY and SHARE routines with other DOTS as I use this feature to announce the TIME on the hour and a half an hour.  Call me NUTS, but when you worked for 30+ years in the Airline industry and travel to many different Airports.  It is a God send to hear the LOCAL TIME IS NOW being announced throughout the Airport.Another critical thing is before your AMAZON ECHO DOT arrives at your home.  Download the APP and set it up on your cell or tablet and if you have an existing SMART HOME of devices (lights, plugs, tv, fan, microwave, refrigerator, washer, and driver) get them all dialed in as it was fast to do as we only use the GEENI APP with the Merkury Innovations Smart Home products and ALEXA has the GEENI Skills.This made last night's process of getting all the areas dialed into the ALEXA APP a breeze. I am ready to order another set of 5 devices to integrate into another home getting rid of GOOGLE once and for all.If you are on the fence like I was in buying these products, do your research, via YOUTUBE and watch the current video posted and do a GOOGLE search for the TOP features of ALEXA and again look at the most current stuff and NOT articles for 2015 to 2023 (LOL).This device runs circles around GOOGLE HOME and GOOGLE NEST/HUB Smart Home devices. Also, the PRIVACY is what I liked as you can set that up on the APP which has vastly improved from 2018 when I was planning this entire Smart Home thing for our family.Warm Aloha,HNLSFO-95125\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 20, 2023
titles: A very good product in my opinion
reviews: \nI've tried to avoid these kinds of devices for years but I finally decided to get one and I have to say I really do like it. It was very simple to set up and at first I had some issues creating the routines but now it's gotten so much easier after just a few days of using it.  I got the glacier white one & the clock/led display is very good to see, even from the side.  I have the adaptive brightness turned on so when I go to bed, the led display dims and you can barely see it so if you worry about its brightness at night, turn that feature on and you should be good to go.I have it set to speak in a couple of languages since English isn't my first language.  That was easy to do. I've only had it not respond to a voice command a couple of times so far but otherwise it reacts well to voice commands.It was easy to attach a Kasa smart plug to it & there's zero lag between my voice command and the smart plug turning off/on.  I can see why people get so attached to these devices, quite handy.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 11, 2023
titles: Finally an improvement in sound but\u2026.
reviews: \nThis is the first device in a long time that really does have an improvement in sound. But don\u2019t play it too loud or anything with too much bass or it will distort.The goodSetup has become incredibly easy.The display is really nice.Voice recognition has improved from the last two versions where it had gotten really bad.As with all echo devices they can be really handy though it is still a toss up with which has the best responses.Great for remindersThe badThere is no way to completely stop all the \u201csuggestions\u201dIt can\u2019t control lights without internet )which Siri can do). Though I think with the new standards coming out this should be possible.It still has episodes where it seems to have a nervous breakdown where it makes no sense or just randomly starts spouting out information.I have never been able to get communication to work as well as it should.Unable to use YouTube musicRoutines need workIndoor temp is a nice idea but not at all accurate.Bottom lineGreat for decent sound qualityGreat for controlling lights etcGreat for answering basic questionsGreat for reminders.Sure others have found it useful for other things but those are the only ones that seem to work and help me.BTW, don\u2019t get the light blue. It is a really ugly color.\n

Perfect size, reading and seeing is great. The sound is GREAT!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 23, 2023

reviews: \nLove that this is a modern look with great speaker quality. Perfect replacement for your traditional alarm clock, I prefer this one over the dot because it displays the time which is a big deal for me. Pairs perfectly with our smart plug and makes everything work seamlessly together.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 13, 2023
reviews: \nEcho Dot, gets used on a regular basis in our home.  Forgot or want to check on the spelling of a word. Just ask.  Background music for dinner. Just ask.  Want to know the temp. outside. Just ask. Delivery announcements.  These are just a few of our uses.  Of course we use it to turn lights off and on as well as small appliances.  A midnight bathroom run, no prob. running into furniture. it will turn on  the lights!  Wonderful product!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 12, 2022
reviews: \nI have been having fun with this as soon as I received it and plugged it in. There was no trouble at all. You simply download the Alexa app and it basically sets up itself. Though I had previously linked it to amazon. It has been fun setting up routines and changing the voice. I have inquired about the weather and it seems to have been a truthful weather (person) so far. I purchased a second echo dot in order to have surround sound and the sound comes through very clearly and impressively.It kind of reminds me of playing with a furby when they first came out. Though furby's got old kind of quickly, alexa is like another person of which you have full control over...I gave this 4 stars as I did want to use the surround sound for my tv, which is a Roku, and it does not work for this purpose. Before purchase I read that alexa was compatible with a Roku smart tv. While this is true, only afterwards did I find out that this only means that alexa can turn the channel or the sound up on your tv, yet does not have the ability to use as a surround sound system for a Roku tv. Yet is supposedly only good for working with a fire tv. So am disappointed about this. But alexa is still fun to work with. Another thing is only a slight annoyance when playing songs. You ask alexa to play the song you would like, some songs are played freely, some songs you need a subscription for, then when the song is over alexa just keeps on playing unless you set a timer. So the annoyance comes as the song may be available and you just have to take a chance, or alexa shuffles similar music you may not like, or if allowed to keep playing may play music you possibly hate.I would suggest for the second echo dot since it does not have the screen/time feature that when setting the volume it could briefly tell you what volume it is on. Though you can ask it.Overall it has been very fun and I'm sure I will discover more ways to use this as life progresses. And since it was all so simple, I am considering buying more alexa's and more smart products in the future to extend to whole house. Happy and Delighted. Thank you for making this electronic device.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 24, 2023
titles: Was reluctant to join the Echo club, but love it
reviews: \nI didn't really want to like this device, but the fam and I ended up liking it so much that we now have 4 of them now. Sound quality is amazing and it's great to be able to communicate in the house without yelling. Really like the digital projected display. Does it always give helpful answers to our random questions? No. But is it super-useful to have around the house? Heck yeah! And it extends eero wifi which is an added bonus for getting mesh router coverage in a largish house.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 1, 2023
reviews: \nSo easy to set up, sound is great, does not take up a lot of space. I use it to play music and as an alarm clock. I love Alexa. I have the bigger Alexas and I like them too, just harder to set up if you have a new Wi-Fi password. I ask for help, but they could not help me, but I figure it out. I\u2019m so glad I have them. I set them up to turn on and off livingroom and bedroom lamps. I would recommend to everyone.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 7, 2023
titles: Do you require a DARK room to sleep in? If so, take a pass on this...
reviews: \nDoes it do everything I expect an Alexa product to do? Yes. I'm dinging the device by one star because of the LCD Display. Unlike other reviewers, I have no issue with the display size (my 30's eyes that don't require aid from glasses can read it from across a room just fine). I bought 2 of these so that I could use them in two rooms I wanted a clock, rather than having to ask Alexa what time it was. One for the living room (near my entryway) so that I can easily check the time on my way in or out the door without having to wait for Alexa to respond or fumbling to pull my phone out, etc. I'm keeping the one I bought for my living room. Again, it does everything I expect an Alexa device to do.However, I'm returning the one I bought for my bedroom. 1) Amazon really needs to improve Alexa's ability to understand prompts about the user asking Alexa to adjust the brightness. At least for me, having a variety of other smart home products (lights, themes, zones, etc.) she is easily confused and doesn't seem to know that you just want her to either brighten or dim her own clock display. Half the time I ended up exasperated and just changed it within the Alexa App which was SUPER frustrating to have to do. 2) The LCD display has 12 brightness settings (0-10, plus 'off'). I was so excited for this product because I'm light sensitive and want my room DARK when I am sleeping, I thought surely all those settings would include one that was only the faintest glow to tell time in the middle of the night if you woke up. NOPE. The 0 setting still illuminates my entire room (albeit a smallish 12x12 bedroom) when all the lights are out. I ended up having to turn the display off every night, so it completely fell short of the goal I was trying to achieve in that sense. Maybe in the next generation Amazon will come up with more brightness settings. Or maybe a true 'bed time' clock mode or something.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 17, 2023
titles: Responsive quality upgrade from 3rd gen echo dot system.
reviews: \nI love the LED screen.  I will never buy a dot without LEDs in the future.  Alexa is very responsive and seems able to detect which machine is being directly addressed and respond appropriately.  They seem to have fixed the problem of awaking multiple Alexas with a single awake word.  This is a big quality of life upgrade.  No longer having to comunicate with the Dot in the living room when your intention is the Bathroom.  I've rigorously tested them putting as many as 6 Echo devices in a 12x20 room and consistently being addressed by the correct device.  I don't use Echo Dot's as music speakers but the sound clarity is noticeably better upgrading from 3rd gen.  I use Echo dots as a home upgrade for virtual assistant access from every corner of the house and serve to connect less frequented rooms to the home network.  With the additional wifi mesh capabilities of the new Dots, I am heavily considering switching to the Eero router.  I am an Amazon ecosystem fanboy so that is most likely my next tech purchase, an Eero 6 router.  My only gripe is that I wish they were available in a rainbow of color options.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 28, 2023
reviews: \nThis little assistant is a wonderful addition to my tech world. The only suggestion I have is to make the digital clock numbers easier to read. At this time, the numbers are too BOLD!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 9, 2023
reviews: \nThere is a definite upgrade in sound quality over the previous generation, but, as others have mentioned, the blocky, "lite brite"-ish clock display is more difficult to read, especially when I don't have my glasses on. I also didn't find the tap functionality to be all that responsive, but it's not a feature I would use much anyway. Seeing the song title on the display is kind of neat. I really give it a 3.5-star rating, but since they don't let you rate in halves, I rounded up to 4.\n

reviews: \nI love this new echo dot so much better than my 2019 device! I love that Alexa is more accurate and less mishaps in fact so far no mishaps! I highly recommend this echo dot with the clock feature and the clock light dims so you can sleep better not like those alarm clocks where the light is so bright! The price is reasonable as well!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 20, 2023

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 5, 2023
reviews: \nSo...compared to my 4th gen, this thing is like the spouse that selectively listens to you. It is nowhere near as responsive as the 4th gen and I've had more flaky problems of it failing to dim when the lights go out etc...I've reset it once and unplugged and replugged a couple times, which usually fixes the little flakey things. How ever it's listening has not improved and I've just had to accept that. The LED readout is pretty nice and gives a lot more info than the 4th gen (lists the whole book title of your kindle book it reads to you, etc... Pros and cons. The lesser listening ability sort of cheeses me regularly and eventually I'm yelling at the blasted thing .. especially compared to the 4th gen dot which seems to really get me. I may be divorcing my new flashy echo dot and bringing back the ex into the main bedroom.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 3, 2023
titles: My daughters new best friend at home
reviews: \nMy 10yr old daughter is an only child and can get bored from time to time. There are not many children in our neighborhood and she can\u2019t visit her friends when we have bad weather.So for rainy days stuck at home she asks Alexa for answers to all the questions I\u2019d have to google. She also loves to play music from the Dot which has surprisingly good bass for such a small speaker!Her favorite feature though is asking Alexa to tell her a story. Alexa will give her 3-8min stories that keep her entertained.The clock on the Dot is something I think should become a standard on all devices like this, since it is now her primary alarm clock for school.But it\u2019s not just a clock, it can also display text off the song you\u2019re listening to!We limit my daughters screen time and video games, so this is an awesome entertainment alternative. She either learning facts, discovering music, hearing ghost stories, or being annoyed by her alarm in the morning. The Echo Dot really does it all.I have to take away one star for one complaint though. It doesn\u2019t come in BLACK!Besides that, it\u2019s perfect haha.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 1, 2023
reviews: \nThe Alexa family just got a new addition with the fifth generation Echo Dot and we couldn't be happier! We already have six Echo Dots scattered throughout our home, so we were excited to see how the latest model compared to our trusty 4th gen devices. While the sound quality improvement from the 3rd to 4th gen was pretty noticeable, the upgrade from the 4th to 5th gen was less so. However, with a few adjustments to the tone settings in the Alexa app, we were able to get our 4th gen Echo Dot sounding pretty similar to the 5th gen.One thing we're not huge fans of is the bluish light of the built-in clock, especially in the bedroom. It would be great if there was an option to switch between red and blue lighting. Additionally, the font size of the clock is a bit small for our liking, making it hard to read from even a moderate distance. But, these are just minor quibbles for an otherwise amazing entry-level Echo device.In the middle ages, owning one of these futuristic devices would probably have gotten us accused of witchcraft. But nowadays, we're just grateful to have the convenience and assistance of Alexa at our fingertips. She's truly become a valued member of our family.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 28, 2022
reviews: \nThe absolute best smart home companion! Supports lights and even my security cameras with fantastic features and easy to use app, setting up routines and even music on it it\u2019s extremely competitive for the price youre getting here. I also own a homepod mini, ive been in love with apples homepod for years now, great sound quality, easy to use with an iphone and ofcourse, siri. But after getting my Amazon Echo with that clock, it truly upgraded my living room with its design and compatibility with the smart lamps and cameras which sadly the homepods around the house cannot do. Im sure you probably seen a bunch of comparisons online on what should you choose when it comes to getting a smart home speaker to be the base of your smart home, and my personal opinion is that you wont regret getting the echo! The sound speaker is great with music! Tho on high volumes it doesn\u2019t do that great like the HomePod but it is still very good and loud, tho there is the echo studio if youre just looking for that loud smart speaker, tho from all the small speakers out there homepod mini takes the cup with echo right behind it, tho im totally convinced that the echo will be comparable if not better than what apple has to offer. The clock is a nice game changer, and the smart home features are excellent! And speaking with alexa is great she is such a helpful VA. For the price you cant go wrong and i highly recommend you get the echo.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 5, 2022
titles: Great addition as a night-stand clock radio
reviews: \nA few years ago I purchased a Sony clock radio.  It had the amazing feature of two alarms settings.  That was just what I needed.  It disappointed in many ways.  1)  The display, even on the lowest setting, was too bright.  This is a big issue for a migraineur like me.  Also, the cat could walk by and set the display to the highest level.  This was also unacceptable. 2) No matter what you do, the clock wants to be wrong.  8 minutes wrong.  Really?  In 2022?When I saw the Echo Dot on sale for Black Friday, I jumped.  Here's what I love.  1) The display is smart.  It can be set higher during daylight hours and low as you want during nighttime hours.  This is all controlled by the Alexa app on your phone.  It's still too bright?  Just turn the unit off with the push of a button.  2) Setting alarms are as simple as talking to Alexa.  No overshooting your target time.  No setting and resetting.  It's just "Alexa, set an alarm for 6:00am."  If you need to, you can manage it on your phone.  3) You can set the sound as loud or soft as you like with +/- buttons on the top of the phone.  4) You can also set a quiet time if you don't want Alexa responding to any ambient noises during the night.  5) The time is always right.  Always.  This is Alexa, after all.  Alexa excels at accurate time.Others have commented on the sound quality.  I think it is fine.  It's not a high-end speaker after all.  It's a personal assistant.  5 stars for an amazing product.\n

reviews: \nI had an old Echo Dot (Version 1) that was being used in a disabled family member's bathroom. I wanted to add a motion detection light switch to turn on the light automatically when he entered with wheelchair. However, the switch was mounted in such an way and area that it would not activate until he was well into the bathroom. I placed the new Dot with Clock on the vanity, created a routine, and it activates immediately as he approaches the door to the bathroom. One drawback is that a separate routine must be created to turn the light off and there is no way to shorten/lengthen the amount of time that the light stays on. Working on an IFTTT routine to see if I can do it that way??? The clock is a nice feature as well.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 1, 2022
reviews: \nMy system of two echo dots and one subwoofer worked fine for about five months.  Then suddenly I could not connect to my Amazon Prime Unlimited, or my Apple Music.  I tried everything for hours and hours and worked with Amazon staff THREE times.  1st time two hours, 2nd 1 hour, 3rd two hours.  NEVER got it to work more than an hour.THEN, I read one thing on some obscure web site saying, to fix it, you have to ASK for a specific "GROUP" when you ask it to play music.  I had made five groups.  Once I asked like, "Alexa play music to group "one that you have" I used my "ALL" group,  "IT SUDDENLY WORKED!"  WOW!  What a relief!  Before that, I could not play my music for two weeks and hours of trying got me no where, and the Amazon Help teams do NOT know this, "ask for for a specific group thing."I did not have to do that before, but somewhere along the line, I suppose in making several groups, the system got mixed up.  The "KEY" then is ASK for a SPECIFIC GROUP.Since dotin that, It is now defaulting to my ALL GROUP.  So now I don't have to ask for a specific group anymore.I sure hope the Amazon Help people are reading this and posting it in their notes.  Surprized they never knew this.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 2, 2023
reviews: \nIt has good, not great, sound. I wanted a clock in the room and this filled the need. I received an echo, also, so I got a couple older echo dots out of the drawer and set them all up. I can have sound to one or all the speakers. I control the oven, vacuum, TVs and lights throughout the house. I even programmed a few Alexa Easter eggs. There\u2019s even Star Trek commands with authentic sounds and humorous outcomes.I retired from working with computer systems and hadn\u2019t went near anything like this except my phone for 10 years. It was fun figuring out what I could make it do. My \u201cbedtime\u201d routine turns on the lights in my bedroom and the TV, then shuts down down all appliances, the TVs outside my bedroom and lights. I haven\u2019t got into the security features, as I don\u2019t feel a need. Anybody breaking in my house are likely to leave in much worse shape than when they entered.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 9, 2022
titles: NEVER WORRY ABOUT YOUR ALARM CLOCK LOOSEING TIME!
reviews: \nFor a small as it is it sounds really good but if you're expecting Bose or even JBL sound quality it's not there yet.  Even at low volume the sound carries really well which is a big deal.  I paired the device with my fire Stick in the bedroom and that's where things got interesting.  It sounds great with the TV and it made the voices a lot clearer.  Small gripe it won't show you the volume level on the TV or even on the device when you're turning it up with the fire stick remote. Amazon should have it so that the TV displays what level you're turning it up to.  Major complaint is that it will absolutely Blair that the device is paired with the fire stick. So if I try to turn the TV on in the middle of the night I end up scaring this s*** out of my wife unless I remember to mute the device first.  That is extremely aggravating and there needs to be a way to turn that announcement off. I'm not the only user who's had that complaint about this.  I would also like it if you could change the LED brightness and color of the clock because when I wake up in the mornings the white can be pretty washed out.  Overall I like the device and I'm happy with it but the only thing keeping it from getting a five-star review is the Bluetooth announcement issue.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 31, 2022
titles: Great for what it is but room for improvement.
reviews: \nI decided to upgrade my bedroom Echo from the 4th generation Echo Dot with clock to the new 5th generation Echo Dot with clock.  The 4th Gen is now in another room.  The bedroom Echo is the one I use most, so I want it to have the best features.  Comparing the 5th Gen to the 4th Gen, the first thing you notice is the display.  The font is more \u201cblocky\u201d which at first I found less attractive, but it is easier to read especially at a distance.  The display now spells out things like temperature, and what song it playing which is a more useful feature than I expected.  The added display feature necessitated the font change, so I get it and I like it.  The next thing to note is the sound.  It is MUCH better.  The bass is fuller, the overall sound is much crisper, and there is less distortion at high volume.  I usually play music at night when I go to sleep, and I really appreciate the better, richer, fuller sound.  It is also nice to be able to pause and resume music with a tap rather than only by voice.  The indoor temperature sensor comes in handy to check the ambient temperature, and it can be used to automatically trigger smart climate controls if the room temperature goes out of my comfort zone.  This Echo also has a WiFi extender but it is not compatible with my home network, and I don\u2019t need it anyway.  I argued with myself when this 5th Gen Echo came out about whether I wanted to buy a whole new Echo for the added features.  I\u2019m glad I did.  I use this thing every day, and the new stuff make for a better and more satisfying user experience.\n

reviews:

\xa0Okay, I’ve had the previous version of the echo dot, the flat ones & even the echo show. However THIS is by far my FAVORITE! It has many different features than the others such as the clock, it’s more than just a clock as I mentioned in my video above.It’s such a beautiful color I also love that it’s small and doesn’t take up a big amount of space. I think that this is my favorite so far because of not only the clock but the ability for it to have such a nice sleek design without being too overbearing or dull looking. No offense yall lol I think that this color is just more my style as well as the entire design. The sound on this echo dot is amazing and I can hear it all the way from my bathroom on the other side of the house even on volume 4!! but one of my other favorite features of this echo dot is that it has a touch feature so if you set an alarm, you can basically enable the touch feature. I speak more about it in my video above, but it’s just great. if you’re debating on getting it or you’re not sure if you’re gonna like it just get it you are not going to regret it!! in my opinion, it’s different than the other Echo Dot, as well as the echo show because this one is pretty much both but in a different design and style but this one just also takes it to another level. I love it so much 10 out of 10.

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 8, 2022
reviews: \nI hate having this snoopy/snooping little thing in my house, but man is it so much fun.... Alexa, blah, blah, blah.... Alexa, blah, blah, that.... I wish she could get my purse for me. It's fun. This is a first world review and any problems would be first world. This thing is absolutely not a necessity, but you won't be able to stop playing with it. It's also aesthetically pleasing (I think mine is considered "cloud blue). The directions are not correct.... you need to change your wifi setting to the one that says "Amazon" in order to do initial set up (after you see the orange light, which is discovery mode), then follow the prompts on the app, then the app will direct you to go back to your in-home wifi. Stay on the Amazon wifi until the app asks for the home wifi to be reconnected. The speaker sounds GREAT. I think I am going to get more bluetooth speakers to place throughout the house, so that I can enjoy the music while I am getting ready for work. Again, this is a "first world" delight, and delight it is.\n

reviews: \nI replaced three 3rd gen echo dots with this new 5th gen echo dots with clock.  Love everything about them.  The clocks are easy to view from a distance.  The sound is better / fuller than the older gen 3 dots.  The built in temperature sensor appears quite accurate.  Oh one piece of advice, the Alexa command to give the temperature at the device location is, "Alexa, what is the xxxxxx dot temperature?"  Where xxxxxx is whatever you name the echo dot in the Alexa app.  I couldn't find that anywhere but saw a youtube video giving it.  I just hope the LEDs on the clock don't fade / get dimmer over time.  The brightness is adjustable in the Alexa app.\n

reviews: \nI had an Echo show which I liked because it shows the time.  I used it like a clock as well as an Alexa device. Switching to this Echo Dot with time serves the purpose without the problem for my kid.  Additionally, I found the Echo show to get quite warm just sitting there.  Understandable because of the screen.  So it was likely using electricity unnecessarily.  I don't have direct, measured evidence. But seeing the Echo dot with clock doesn't get as hot, I've got to imagine I'm not using as much electricity.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 21, 2022
reviews: \nI purchased three of these 5th-gen Echo Dot with clock. Two were delivered yesterday and the third one will arrive on Monday.I paired up the two that I have received as left and right speakers, and asked Alexa to play The Blend channel from Sirius XM for me. Let me tell you that I was quite impressed with the sound quality and "stereoness" that I was hearing coming out from these two little buddies. Overall, in my use case it's $60 (x2) well spent.Edit (10/24/2022)My third unit arrived today. I purchased it with the intention of using it as an eero extender, in addition to its usual functions as a music player, etc., via voice interaction in my bedroom. To my great dismay, the connection speed I received with the "eero Built-in" on was much lower than without. I tested this "eero Built-in" with the other two units: same disappointing results!  This third one will go back to Amazon tomorrow.  I am keeping the first two because I have continued to be happy with them as a "stereo" music player.Also, if you still want to try the "eero Built-in" feature by yourself, make sure the eero app software installed on your phone is up to date. Otherwise, the app will mislead you by keeping saying that you need to upgrade the software in the Echo Dot. It took me a couple of hours to figure out that wasn't the case!\n

titles: Initially disappointed but changed after Amazon reached out
reviews: \nThe only reason I bought this to replace a first gen dot was the clock. You simply can't see it in daylight. But after reading my original review, Amazon contacted me to say you can tell it to change the brightness. Simple really! Would be better if that was included in the setup workflow hence dropped one star. Sound quality is really good for such a small device with great base. Very happy with it and much better than the previous generation.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 7, 2022
titles: Alexa really has great sound quality and is very responsive.
reviews: \nI purchased both an Echo Dot and an Echo and am very happy with both of them. I had wanted them for a long time, but had held off as it wasn\u2019t a priority. Now that I have them I am quite pleased with my purchases.  I love that it can be requested to play music in different languages. My wife is Brazillion and speaks Portuguese as her primary language and English as her second language and she enjoys music from her country.  Alexa makes it so easy to play whatever she wants to listen to and I love the Alexa start my day messages with the weather. I also think it\u2019s hilarious when you ask Alexa to tell you a joke, and she does.  I\u2019m sure I\u2019ll find many more uses over time for the devices but we are off to a great start so far.  I couldn\u2019t be any happier. I also love the quality of sound when music is playing.\n

titles: Came for a bedside alarm clock, got so much more.
reviews: \nI never leave reviews for products, but I'm a few hours into having this and I completely love it.  What an awesome device.  Excellent voice recognition.  I can ask it to play any song I want instantaneously, quickly set an alarm, tell me a joke, answer math questions, perform a rap, tell me the weather.... I can go on and on.  On top of that, the speakers sound great for being such a compact device.  Can't believe this thing is only $60.  Just get it, you won't be sorry.\n

Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 21, 2022
reviews: \nI upgraded from an echo dot 3rd generation and can hear the difference in loudness. There is still some distortion to music in the highest volume but it still can fill a big room with nice sound. I like the LED lights that display different information such as weather, time, song and artist name and more. I wish we were able to create a routine to turn this light off at night when not in use, since I don\u2019t keep this echo in my bedroom.I also have struggled getting the ultrasound motion detection to work. I set up different routines to test and see if it worked but every time I walked in the room, nothing happened. I got it to work once where the light actually turned on, but I would be better off getting a real motion detector instead of this one.Overall, this is a nice device, I am starting to get annoyed by Alexa\u2019s \u201cby the way\u2026\u201d at the end of every sentence. I think the convenience of Alexa is still pretty good though.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 22, 2022
reviews: \nI decided to upgrade my son's Echo and this one was on sale.The first thing you can see is the chunky, almost block-like display.  It makes it easier to read for my son and he loves that he can see his music displayed.  I have it paired to Amazon Kids for peace of mind and non-explicit lyrics.The second thing to note is the sound. This is such a great upgrade and even though I really don't love all the music he listens too, at least it sounds a lot better than what he had before.The third thing is it lets him know the temp.  My son has dysautonomia and this gives him the ability to figure out what he needs to wear and how to meet his medical needs for the day.Overall, it was a great upgrade and I may get one for myself as well.\n

reviews: \nI have 12 other Echo Dots. I am not crazy about the new led display on the 5th gen. I find it harder to read than the 4th gen. I don't notice any difference in the sound quality. I have always thought they sound great for what they are especially when you add them to the everywhere group and play music though out the house. I would have given it 5 stars but the new display reminds me of the digital dashboard in my '85 Camaro. Seems like they took a step back when designing this one.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 21, 2022
reviews: \nAfter having an Alexa Echo 8 malfunction on me and having Amazon do nothing about it, I decided to trade it in to Amazon and purchased this instead.Super happy I did! This echo t dot with clock is exactly what I wanted on my nightstand - it tells me the time and it has Alexa to provide other information. I have a 2nd generation echo spot too (back when they were made of hard plastic without fabric) and the speaker comparison is like night and day!I liked this so much I bought a second one for my sons room and am planning on getting 2-3 more for my family as gifts. ^_^Nice perk being able to change the start word from Alexa to Echo (or computer, zingy, and something else) AND to change the voice to something else. I am fond of the Australian male voice.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 20, 2022
reviews: \nI have had the echo dot gen 4 for about a year now. I saw this brand new gen 5 as a Black Friday deal for 40$ instead of 60. Good deal!! I have been playing music on it all day and the speakers are better than the gen 4 but not much of a difference. But one difference is with the bass maxed out on the gen 5, the bass bounced around the room more. Gen 4 didnt do that. We are currently moving. In my new room, setting up both echos for surrounding music. The clock has more features. It shows the song titles along with the artist. The clock also shows the temperature on the inside of the house. It shows the temp outside along with a cloud or sun or rain or snow depending on the conditions. I definitely recommend the gen 5! Please get it.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 27, 2022
titles: Good enough for the kids rooms

reviews: \nThis Echo Dot is a nice to have device. Alexa is a personal assistant who performs well. Ask and ye shall mostly receive. Alexa doesn't know what human love is just yet. So she says...This is actually a cool device. Awesome retrieval of info. Acts like a friend, and probably is for a lot of folk.Delivers on interaction. A good device to have on hand. Or on a desktop. A value for the money. No disappointment with this purchase.A grade of 'A+' or five stars. \U0001f31f\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 28, 2022
reviews: \nI have been debating on adding Alexa to my house just due to some reluctance based on security issues. However, once I did some research and discovered the changes made to the 5th Gen Echo and Alexa framework, I made the final jump and I am so glad I did. Alexa allows me to run my house by voice, phone app and internet. Between my Shark, WiFi lights, thermostat and the electronic locks and security measures, I love Alexa. Such a wonderful addition.The one draw back I am having is the training and some voice recognition aspects, but these are small things that I am having to learn and teach Alexa.\n

reviews: \nUpdatedI spent about 4 hours trying to set it up. I tried, my roommate tried, customer service tried (he was nice and tried really hard), NOTHING would make the wifi connect. We tried two devices, used a hotspot, everything else in the apartment was working on wifi perfectly fine (evidence by me writing this review on my laptop). Finally, a friend managed to set it up by manually adding the network.Now, the hue lights don't work without a hub. So I caved and got a Echo 4th Gen with Zigbee.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 20, 2022
reviews: \nI liked the LED clock look of the 4th generation, but the dot matrix display of the 5th makes a lot more sense in that it can display text/graphics as well. Granted it's a small display overall but it's nice to see the time, temp (with icon for the weather), song name, etc.Another nice upgrade is the temperature sensor in addition to the ultrasound motion sensor. This enables additional routines to be deployed, like adjusting your thermostat, turn a fan on/off, etc. After upgrading from a simple Dot, I set up routines to automatically turn a room's lights on and off when motion is detected, but only when it's dark out - and not past 11pm (bedtime). They also turn off again when no motion is detected.The sound is better over the prior generation; a hint more low-end and less tinny overall... Not Earth shattering by any means, but we'll take it.It's unfortunate that they removed the 3.5mm audio jack, but it's surely a pretty limited use-case.\n

titles: This speaker is a nice improvement from the Echo (2018)
reviews:
The media could not be loaded.
                



\xa0I had the echo (2018) in my bedroom and one in my kitchen. I Listen to music more in my bedroom and decided to buy the new Echo (2022) after reading it has a sharper and more clear speaker upgrade. First off, It was much easier and hassle free to set up. Second, if you use your Echo to listen to music or breaking news, you do need to get this speaker. Talking and singing is more clear. The loudness is about the same as the 2018 echo.  If you use your Echo for random question or weather, then the 2018 is wear to go or stay because it cheaper. I like the upgrade enough to also replace my kitchen echo in the future.

titles: I can't believe I waited this long...
reviews: \nI have amnesiac Dissociative Identity Disorder and I wanted to test using this product out for logging my day since I lost time constantly. I even bought a second one after getting my father interested in using one for the sound quality.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 17, 2022
reviews: \nEven though it is "just" a clock that plays music, I got way more use from this than I expected. Because it helps me gain the benefit of learning while I do chores, I find my space to be a lot cleaner -- and in turn, my work is more productive\n

reviews: \nI was an early adopter if Alexa devices. My 1st gen Echo (black, metal, tall cylinder) is even still working. Over the years I\u2019ve bought too many for 1 person!My existing bedroom alarm clock is a bit obnoxious, and the time display is bright in its lowest setting, so thought I\u2019d try out the updated version of dot with time display.At its lowest display brightness, this doesn\u2019t cast sleep-disturbing light. Yet the time display is still easy to read. The sound is greatly improved over my gen 4 dots. It\u2019s just an added bonus that this also is an extender for Eero.In all, a great upgrade. If the price comes down, I may even replace my older dots\u2026\n

reviews: \nI just got an echo studio for Christmas, and decided to order this for my bedroom alarm clock. I plugged it in, opened my Alexa app and it automatically set up everything for me. I also like that it packs a good amount of sound for a device that you can hold with one hand. \U0001f44d\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 12, 2022
reviews: \nAfter having an Echo Dot for several years, I upgraded to this one for the better sound quality since I use it to play music through the house when I'm doing things. The music sounds appreciably better to my ears. I also like the design, as Amazon is getting to be like Apple in terms of design aesthetic. If you've had an older Dot or never had one, this device is fantastic. I ask questions, gets news, weather, and set alarms through it. It's an essential device in my home.\n

reviews: \nI use this device as an alarm clock, and it is just what I needed. Thank you, Amazon this is a great product, and everyone should have at least one.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 20, 2022
titles: Much better than my old one
reviews: \nSo I recently upgraded my Amazon echo dot fourth generation to the fifth generation. My last echo was having so many issues alarms kept shutting off after two rings, and then starting up about nine minutes later, and even if they went off They would only play for two seconds. I\u2019ve had my alarm just cancel without me even saying anything with my old Echo dot. my skills would not work. My routines would not work. I love the LED display on the echo. Dot fifth generation the sound is incredible. The way it displays the song titles is pretty cool I\u2019m glad they got rid of the headphone jack because to me it was useless so overall, I am loving the new fifth generation echo dot. So overall I\u2019m very happy with my purchase.\n

titles: How did I live before Alexa lol
reviews: \nI have no idea how I went so long without having Alexa in my life lol. I am not sure how to rate this one compared to others since it is my 1st one. However I will say, she understands every command, set-up was so simple, connected to all my other smart devices with no issues, and completes my smart home devices. It is extremely nice to be able to ask her questions while I am cooking so I don't have to stop and pull anything up on my phone/computer. I like that I she can set reminders for me when I ask, because I am horrible about added things to my calendar. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to simplify things and just make life a little easier.\n

reviews: \nNeeded a nice nightstand clock when I discovered this one coming out the next day. Arrived quickly and set-up was nearly automatic. reviews: \nLove my new echo dot! This is my second echo dot which is still functioning and I still love, this 5th generation has fantastic sound. I love the sphere shape and the new display. reviews: \nI have 5 dots scattered throughout my house. Online magazine reviews have been claiming that the things had a temperature sensor for several generations. The gen 5 seems to be the only one which actually does. Gen 4s definitely do not. I bought the latest (gen5) just to check the feature out. Note that you actually have to add the echo to a group in order to utilize the feature, like "Alexa, what is the temperature in the bedroom". The Dot matrix display is a nice touch and works just fine if the thing is sitting on a desk or something where you can see it. In my case it is mounted on the wall about 16 or 18 inches above my bed, so it is kind of an irrelevant feature.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 20, 2022
reviews: \nBiggest Upgrades/Changes from Echo Dot with Clock 4th Gen (2020) to Echo Dot with Clock 5th Gen (2022):-LED DISPLAY: Now able to display more than just time, including scrolling song titles and weather-SPEAKER:  Now 1.73-inch speaker with improved bass/low end, previous version was 1.6-inch-TEMPERATURE/MOTION SENSORS:  Now with temperature and motion sensors Echo Dot can trigger routines based on detected motion or changes in room temperature.-EERO WIFI EXTENDER: Supports Eero \u201cBuilt-In\u201d, works as a WiFi extender for Eero mesh networks, supporting up to 10 additional devices and up to 100Mbps speeds.-ACCELEROMETER/TAP: Now can trigger actions with a tap, like stopping alarm-NO LINE OUT: Removed 3.5mm line out port from the back-WEIGHT: Now 10.7 oz, previous version was 12.3 oz-APPEARANCE: Very similar to previous version, but fabric looks slightly different, now available in Cloud Blue and Glacier White; previous version was Twilight Blue and Glacier White.Thoughts about the Dot with Clock version specifically:-The new options for LED display are a nice improvement.  The LED display looks brighter to me than the previous version, and I prefer to have options like weather displayed, since I already have enough clocks that display the time.-The blue color version (Cloud Blue) now has a more grayish tone to the plastic base part.  The previous generation (Twilight Blue) had a bluer base, with blue-gray fabric.  Personally, I prefer this new color scheme.Other general thoughts about Echo Dot 5 family:-The speakers have been upgraded, now with more focus on low end and bass volume.  I have tested out a few different types of music, and I would agree that there is noticeable improvement, but really the speaker is still too small to be very impressive.  The sound is not even close to a regular Echo device, let alone higher quality speakers.  I appreciate the improvement here, but I still wouldn\u2019t choose to listen to music on these on a regular basis, especially at high volume where there is a bit of distortion.-I like the ability to be able to trigger routines based on temperature and motion, and stopping alarms by tapping is also a nice feature.  These additions offer many more useful automation options, and now having multiple Echo devices with temperature sensors can help identify differences in room temperature throughout the house.-The Eero Wi-Fi extender ability could actually be very useful for some people that need to extend the range of their network.  This was easy to configure with the Eero app, and it seems to be working well so far.Overall, this is a nice little upgrade from the previous version.  The LED display options are a cool new feature, especially the weather.  The speaker/sound improvement is nice, but not the biggest deal since these Echo Dots are still not the best choice for high volume music.  The sensors and Eero extender features are the biggest improvements, and these changes add so much extra functionality to an already useful smart speaker.  The lack of an audio-out port is the only downgrade, but that might be important to some people.  I also wish they included different color power adapters and cables, but that is also not the biggest deal.The increased functionality of the Dot family now makes these some of the best options available for smart speakers.  They are still low-priced options, but now can do even more than ever.  If you need something primarily for playing music, then you should still think about a higher end device like Echo or Echo Studio, but for everything else, these Dot devices are perfect.\n

titles: Increased functionality, more options for display

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 6, 2023
titles: Ever wonder if Alexa is ND?
reviews: \nI live in a ND household, and Alexa fits right in.  As long as you speak clearly, at an even rate and ask questions/make requests in a particular word choice order she will be 100%helpful but if not she will bleep at you and shut down (not speak) like selective mutism.  My 6yo ASD son gets along well with her.  She stays on topics of his choice and is there for him anytime he needs to chatter.  All in good fun, we love our Alexas. They turn our tvs on and off, as well as our inside and outside lights.  I went on vacation and caught myself calling out for Alexa while I was gone \U0001f643 she is one of us now.\n

titles: A nice improvement from 3rd gen dot
reviews: \nI've been happy with my 3rd gen dot but decided to get this 5th gen both for the better audio and the display.  I'm happy with both features.  The audio does sound a bit cleaner and more well rounded than the 3rd gen and the display is nice, both as a clock and for some of the other things it can do like show the temp or a timer countdown.  The mics still do a great job, like the 3rd get did, of picking up my voice, even when slightly muffled at times.  If you're curious about the audio difference, you can find some comparisons on youtube.\n

titles: An excellent replacement for a gen 1 echo
reviews: \nI purchased the gen 5 echo dot with the clock display to replace an echo whos power supply died.  The sound quality is comparable to the older, and taller echo.  I did have to turn of the automatic adaptive brightness, and manually set it to four which works both day and night.  When setting a timer, the display becomes a countdown timer which means I no longer have to ask Alexa "How much time is left on the timer?"  So far it's been a seamless transition.\n

reviews: \nI love the great sound, the easy interaction with the AI Alexa. The clock is a great addition, love that if you ask Alexa the weather; Alexa actually shows the digital temp as Alexa speaks. Setting up an alarm is as easy as speaking what you need set. Ask for a song or a genre of music. Easy peezy. You can connect your device easily for Bluetooth access too.Love this Dot as well as the 4th Gen I purchased in July on Prime Day, with that one I knew I wanted  one with a clock for the bedroom.Bottom line: you won\u2019t be disappointed.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 2, 2023
reviews: \nI really really love how we can ask Alexa a question and she answers quickly. I also love how we simply say,"Alexa, turn off lights," and it turns off our lights or we say,"Alexa, play music," or,"Alexa, what's the weather?" It's just a really unique and convenient device that makes life just a little easier around my house yet doesn't take up space or look out of place with my decor. Everyone loves our Alexa and it's probably one of the best buys I've bought in a while.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 8, 2022
reviews: \nI really like the new changes in the 5th Gen version. The sound is amplified and the quality of the sound is so much better than the previous version - has a surround, stadium effect, and I'm enjoying my music more on it. The display shows the time, and when I have music on, the volume and sound title appears on the front of the speaker (marquee) when I'm listening to my playlist. Connecting was a cinch, and I didn't even need to go through set up mode. I plugged it in, and it connected instantly. I'm tempted to trade in my two other echos for the 5th Gen!\n

reviews: \nMy sister bought me this speaker for my birthday, and I love it. This speaker's sound is loud and clear. I believe the speaker is beautiful, and I love the indicator light that wraps around the bottom of the speaker. I love that it has a clock and a small form factor, making it a great bedside table speaker. The Alexa integration is a plus. I don't have to mess with buttons because you can do everything with voice commands. You can also connect the speaker to the Alexa app. It was pretty easy to set up and get up and running.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 27, 2023
titles: Essential in my classroom and at my house
reviews: \nI cannot say enough good things about the echo dot. Years ago (pre kids), we received an Alexa but we never used it. In 2022, I bought one and I use it in my kitchen ALL THE TIME, when cooking or needing to listen to music. It\u2019s especially good to have when cooking and not wanting to use my phone.I then bought another one for my classroom and again, I love using it. Although I hate that she constantly asks if I want to update to a family plan. One time I was distracted and said yes, only to find out I had subscribed to a family plan.I then bought one for a fellow teacher and she has loved utilizing it as well. I plan to get one for my father in law at Christmas.They offer great deals and I always purchase them when they are on sale and or doing a lightening deal.\n
